materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"7mi3q","text":"4% w/v PFA 4% w/v sucrose in PBS pH 7.3","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"987n4","text":"PBTr (Phosphate buffered saline + 0.5-0.8% Triton-X100)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1gj4r","text":"MeOH","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4iai4","text":"1000X PK at -20°c at 10mg/ml","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qees","text":"Blocking solution: 10% normal goat serum (NGS), 1% DMSO, 0.5-0.8% Triton-X100 in PBS)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f6ds7","text":"PBT","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eteh3","text":"Protocol based on Tom Hawkins' modified version of Jenny Regan's GFP protocol (forked)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":86}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5p61o","text":"Depending on the antigen, you should either fix in PFA or TCA. Always start with PFA (option 1). TCA (option2) can be better for older embryos \u003e36hrs","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebpo1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ea1m3","text":"Either:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ulim","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"acn22","text":"(Option 1) Fix in PFA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eprnq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bi3n","text":"Fix - Fix in sweet Paraformaldehydefix (4% w/v PFA 4% w/v sucrose in PBS pH 7.3) for 3 hrs at room temperature or 4°C overnight ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"gbj4","text":"Wash - After fixing, transfer to 1.5 mL tubes and rinse 2x, and wash 3 x 10 mins in PBTr (Phosphate buffered saline + 0.5-0.8% Triton-X100) on a shaker","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5trq9","text":"(Optional) Dissect brains at this point","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dl8aa","text":"Dehydrate - Transfer to MeOH","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bmnrl","text":"                1 X 5 mins in 50% MeOH / 50% PBTr","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dr406","text":"                2 X rinse in 100% MeOH","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eef42","text":"Store at 20°C for at least 30mins or for up to 6 months (good point to leave overnight)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3srdb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"esj7r","text":"Or:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5haq8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9mkd","text":"(Option 2) Fix in TCA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6nbde","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2kmc5","text":"Fix - 2% TCA in PBS for exactly 3 hrs at room temperature in 5ml bijous","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frbq","text":"Wash - Transfer to 1.5ml tubes, rinse 2x and wash 3 x 5mins PBS (on side)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6p358","text":"Store at 4ºC for a week but add 20mM Azide if storing for longer (to prevent mould). In azide, PBS embryos should keep for a month.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ah3n","text":"This step applies to PFA fixed, MeOH stored embryos only","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":56}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"26n10","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bkvoo","text":"1 x 5mins 50% MeOH / 50% PBTr","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3dh0e","text":"3 x 5mins PBTr","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a2019","text":"For PFA:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3mvte","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"arfu3","text":"Digest at room temperature, with the tube lying on its side (no agitation) (use a 22ºC incubator in high summer or deep winter)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4eapr","text":"     Store PK at -20°c at 10mg/ml – This is 1000x stock","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bkehh","text":"     ProteinaseK (PK) digestion times vary with embryo age. Digest according to the table below","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1531n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qkbi","text":"    Developmental Stage        PK Treatment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":19},{"style":"bold","offset":31,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9t3kb","text":"    Up to tailbud                        no PK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"54jqc","text":"    2 - 10ss                                quick rinse in 1X PK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qtgn","text":"    10 - 15ss                              1 min 1X PK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebltd","text":"    16 - 26ss                              2 min 1X PK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ujfj","text":"    24 hpf                                  15 min 1X PK ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ao09","text":"    30 hpf                                  20 min 1X PK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8h1j5","text":"    36 - 48 hpf                          30 - 40 min 1X PK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpums","text":"    2.5 dpf                                 30 - 40 min 1.5X PK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bplg9","text":"    3 dpf                                    30 - 40 min 2X PK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2a96q","text":"    4 dpf                                    30 - 40 min 3X PK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36f6b","text":"    5 dpf                                    30 - 40 min 4X PK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qsbq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ji99","text":"    Note: If the embryos are dissected, reduce the incubation time or avoid this step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"das1g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"epno6","text":" 2. Rinse 3x PBTr","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qnqe","text":" 3. Post fix in 4% PFA for 20 min at room temperature on gentle shaker","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mko9","text":" 4. Wash 3x 5min PBTr","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7nhl7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15m71","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqd3","text":"For TCA:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6rimq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eibrg","text":"Rinse embryos 3 x 5 mins PBS to remove azide.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a1psc","text":"Prechill trypsin* solution (0.25% in PBS) and 5mL per tube of PBTr on ice until cold.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98m9i","text":"Incubate embryos in trypsin in ice for 5-10 mins (according to age 36hpf - 5dpf) may need longer for older embryos, depending on the trypsin batch, titrate upon first use.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5cl98","text":"Rinse 2x in cold PBTr then 3x10mins in cold PBTr, then bring to RT","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5bcd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qqn7","text":"*Trypsin stock is 2.5^% (10X)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cmq09","text":"Incubate in IB for at least 1 hour at room temp on shaker. (IB: 10% normal goat serum (NGS), 1% DMSO, 0.5-0.8% Triton-X100 in PBS)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e99tb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cifb6","text":"For 1ml IB: 100 mL NGS, 10 mL DMSO, 0.89 mL PBTr","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fcfu0","text":"For 5ml IB: 500 mL NGS, 50 mL DMSO, 4.45 mL PBTr.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ahkj","text":"Incubate in IB + primary antibody overnight at 4°C on shaker","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6d4ha","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"evo1a","text":"Anti-ZIP14: Polyclonal rabbit","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkhq3","text":"AntiGFP: Polyclonal rabbit  α-GFP from AMS Biotechnology (cat #TP401) gives great results. Use 1/1000. AMS Biotechnology, 185A/B Milton Park, Abingdon, Oxon OX14 4SR, UK. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":27,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7edue","text":"Titrate other antibodies upon first use. Monoclonals generally at between 1:100 and 1:1000 Supernatants at 1:5 - 1:50","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2rj2r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"","guid":"BB2D4170D47911ED88BAED6AB1C6D89D","id":0}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"feqns","text":"Remove the primary antibody (primary antibody can be kept at 4°C for reuse within a week) ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8nlmm","text":"Rinse 3x in PBT. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2umsd","text":"Wash at least 4 x 30min in PBTr on shaker.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c9md4","text":"Incubate in IB + secondary antibody overnight at 4°C on shaker","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0fef","text":"If you are using a fluorescently tagged antibody, keep tubes in the dark ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":73}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dl6bi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0bot","text":"Secondary depends upon primary antibody and detection method","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5boqr","text":"For fluorescence: Molecular Probes (www.probes.com) Alexa Fluor 488 goat α-rabbit IgG is good (cat # A-11034). Use at 1:200.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":36,"length":15}],"data":{}},{"key":"9eauo","text":"For non-amplified HRP detection: Sigma (www.sigmaaldrich.com) goat α-rabbit IgG (whole molecule) peroxidase conjugate is good (cat # A-6154). Use at 1:200.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31},{"style":"bold","offset":32,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":40,"length":21}],"data":{}},{"key":"62kuc","text":"For amplified HRP detection: Vector labs (www.vectorlabs.com) biotinylated anti-mouse IgG (#BA-9200) or anti-rabbit IgG (#BA-1000) are both great.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27},{"style":"bold","offset":28,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":42,"length":19}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C23A6ED8D47A11EDB7650A58A9FEAC02","url":"www.probes.com)"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"BD5CD745D47A11EDB7650A58A9FEAC02","url":"www.sigmaaldrich.com)"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D8903C4AD47A11EDB7650A58A9FEAC02","url":"www.vectorlabs.com)"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2q6db","text":"Rinse 3 x in PBSTr","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8be2q","text":"Wash at least 4 x 30 min on shaker","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20hba","text":"If you are using a fluorescently tagged antibody, keep tubes in the dark ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":73}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"504sk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"to69","text":"Fluorescently stained embryos are now ready to image. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":52}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ebdo","text":"Rinse out Triton with PBS. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjha5","text":"Either transfer to 75% glycerol (+AF1 CITIFLUOR) (through 25% and 50% glycerol/PBS) and mount. Or keep in PBS and mount in 1% low melting point agarose in PBS.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eq29r","text":"Keep at 4°C in the dark and image as soon as possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4t6g2","text":"Methanol ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1if72","text":"Some antibodies are particularly sensitive to MeOH. Try omitting the dehydration step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2hbqe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2rgn","text":"Detergent ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dr3v5","text":"Some antibodies are particularly sensitive to detergent. Try swapping PBSTr for PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"busu4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9l4jb","text":"Antigen retrieval ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frla4","text":"Although fixation is essential for preserving tissue morphology, this process can also reduce the detectability of proteins by IHC, due to the formation of chemical modifications. Antigen retrieval is an approach to reduce or eliminate chemical modifications. This step should occur just before PK treatment (after rehydration/washing). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7od23","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vg7a","text":"Antigen Retrieval\n** Incubate in 150mM Tris-HCL pH9 for 15 min at 70oC.\n**WashinPBT2x10min,then**dH202x5min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4le75","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ajbii","text":"Protocol for antigen-retrieval from https://www.aveslabs.com/blogs/protocols/citrate-buffer-antigen-retrieval-protocol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":21},{"style":"italic","offset":30,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":36,"length":82}],"data":{}},{"key":"8ieas","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3A77B885D47F11EDB7650A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.aveslabs.com/blogs/protocols/citrate-buffer-antigen-retrieval-protocol"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6c682","text":"Nuclear staining DAPI","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ujmg","text":"For nuclear staining 4',6-diamidino-2-phenylindole (DAPI, 10 mg/mL) was added to one of the PBSTr washes at a concentration of 1:1000.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8gv89","text":"Phalloidin 647","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32po5","text":"Phalloidin is a highly selective bicyclic peptide used for staining actin filaments (also known as F-actin). It binds to all variants of actin filaments in many different species of animals and plants. Typically, phalloidin is used conjugated to a fluorescent dye, such as FITC, Rhodamine, TRITC or similar dyes, such as Alexa Fluor‱ 488 or iFluor 488.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":332,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"av9vn","text":"Importantly, phalloidin is also pH sensitive: at elevated pH, a key thioether bridge is cleaved, and the phalloidin loses its affinity for actin. Phalloidin staining can be combined with antibody-based staining by adding the phalloidin conjugate during the primary or secondary antibody incubation step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6unbi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dl12c","text":"Phalloidin-iFluor 647","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"8F80FE94982E11EE9C6B0A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}}}}

title: Immunohistochemistry (IHC) Whole-Mount Antibody Staining
